description.p: In a charge, with a twirl then a twist the human slashes with exquisite precision and just as much fervor, lacerating the limbs and in a flurry of steel deals a mortal wound.
A lone dragonborn stands on a ravaged battlefield, facing ruination, he mutters an ancient curse and launches himself in a shockwave that shakes the earth.
The Dragoon is a paragon to the art of polearm combat, with trained precision they strike viciously often destroying everything involved, including the weapon.
Very rarely do people have the connections and training required to become a Dragoon, but they are always a terror on the battlefield when they are produced.
Naturally drawn to the fight, they are rarely seen not taking on the adventurer life.
You can make a Dragoon quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest score, followed by the other, Second choose the Outlander background.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per dragoon level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Choose two skills from Athletics, Acrobatics, Insight, Perception, Survival, Investigation and Stealth

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 6th, 12th, 14th, 16th and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Beginning at 1st level your raw muscle blocks some attacks, your ac equals 7 + Dex Mod + Str Mod.

description.p: Starting at the 1st Level you can lunge at a target and preform a weapon attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 + Weapon Damage.

description.p: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. The Flurry archetype is detailed at the end of the class description; Your archetype grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 16th level.
Starting at 6th level your critical strikes are so violent they automatically deal maximum damage, but this breaks your weapon in two

description.p: Starting at 7th level, you can spend an action to start forming a new spear, you can spend another action on this combat to finish forming the spear, the spear lasts 1 day or until destroyed and deals 1d6 + Strength Modifier damage. In addition you can spend a long rest repairing a broken nonmagical weapon.
Starting at 18th level you can spend once action to from an etherial spear, this spear lasts 1d4 days or until destroyed. You can spend a long rest repairing a nonmagical weapon.
